column4: I get (grub) error 15 when booting my computer. Ubuntu is the only OS i have and it doesnt even help to reinstall ubuntu from scratch. What can be wrong here?
looks like the kernel image cannot be found (googled from 'grub error 15')
ye i thought it meant that it cannot find something. But i have no idea what it is and how to fix it since not even reinstalling works
you can think of the kernel as the OS itself :)
looks like grub error 15 is like the (in)famous command.com not found error of DOS...

the funny thing is that if I put in a bootable disk (like a win install cd) and boot. It comes up "Hit a key to start from cd" then if I DONT hit a key. It goes to grub.. and it start ubuntu normally?! :S
is your partition marked as bootable?
shud be.. I just took "format whole disk and install ubuntu"
sudo fdisk /dev/sda then, p to print partition information shuold tell you
that comman says my cylinders are set to 19457, and that its bigger than 1024
it's ok, I have more than 1024 cyls here too, that's handled by the BIOS when you set the disk to LBA as someone suggested above (and as you should have it set)
do you see an asterisk (*) by one of the partitions?
ok, I guess stefg will keep helping you then
